item.title: Cache url [Dementhium]
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

[quote=“The Outsider, post:3, topic:422761”]Signlink.java. Find something similar to

public static final String findcachedir()

and if you want to read the cache from the client folder simply change the entire method to the following

public static final String findcachedir()
    {
            
    	return "./cache/";
    }

Rename the cache folder “cache”.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Cache url [Dementhium]
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

Mine is like this its the same as yours but mines a little different.

public URL getCodeBase() { try { return new URL(adress +":" + (80 + portOff)); } catch(Exception _ex) { } return null; }
In my client.java i cannot find a place to add the cache link and i am currently using Galkons Client.
If you want to change the cache link look in the CacheDownloader class and see if that works.
EDIT: Now that i look at yours, mine seems way different…

Read full topic

item.title: Cache url [Dementhium]
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Signlink.java. Find something similar to

public static final String findcachedir()

and if you want to read the cache from the client folder simply change the entire method to the following

public static final String findcachedir()
    {
            
    	return "./cache/";
    }

Rename the cache folder “cache”.

Read full topic

item.title: Cache url [Dementhium]
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Is this my cache url I am supposed to change if I wanna change my cache?

The (mainurl)

public URL getCodeBase() { URL url; try { url = new URL(new StringBuilder().append("http://").append(mainurl) .toString()); } catch (Exception exception) { exception.printStackTrace(); return null; } return url; }
